entries.name: Spelljammer Module
entries: Modules are customizations that give your spelljammer unique benefits that can drastically change how your spelljammer functions.

entries.name: Spelljammer Upgrade
entries: Upgrades are extra features you can get added to your spelljammer to make it function more efficiently.

entries.name: Spelljammer Weapon
entries: This weapon must be mounted in a Spelljammer to be operated. It deals mega damage and may only target other Spelljammer vessels or mega-sized creatures.

entries.name: Backfire 2
entries: When you make an attack with this weapon, if the unmodified die roll is equal or less than 2, the weapon breaks after the attack. The weapon remains broken until the Gunner uses their action to repair it.

entries.name: Backfire 3
entries: When you make an attack with this weapon, if the unmodified die roll is equal or less than 3, the weapon breaks after the attack. The weapon remains broken until the Gunner uses their action to repair it.

entries.name: Backfire 4
entries: When you make an attack with this weapon, if the unmodified die roll is equal or less than 4, the weapon breaks after the attack. The weapon remains broken until the Gunner uses their action to repair it.

entries.name: Crew 1
entries: This weapon requires 1 additional crew member to operate.

entries.name: Crew 2
entries: This weapon requires 2 additional crew members to operate.

entries.name: Crew 3
entries: This weapon requires 3 additional crew members to operate.

entries.name: Crew 4
entries: This weapon requires 4 additional crew members to operate.

entries.name: Crew 5
entries: This weapon requires 5 additional crew members to operate.

entries.name: Crew 6
entries: This weapon requires 6 additional crew members to operate.

entries.name: Crew 8
entries: This weapon requires 8 additional crew members to operate.

entries.name: Fixed
entries: When mounted, this weapon is affixed to face a certain direction. It can only make attacks against targets within a 90-degree cone in the direction it is facing.

entries.name: Overheat
entries: Once you make an attack with this weapon, it can't be used again to make an attack until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Special
entries: This weapon deals double damage to bulwark points.

entries.name: Small
entries: This weapon may be mounted in a small hardpoint or greater.

entries.name: Medium
entries: This weapon may be mounted in a medium hardpoint or greater.

entries.name: Large
entries: This weapon must be mounted in a large hardpoint.

item.name: Altar
entries: An altar is an area of a spelljammer designed for worship of a particular deity or power. The design changes from god to god, but the effect remains the same: When a paladin or cleric uses the altar during their daily prayers, they can regain spell slots as if their god had presence in the sphere.

item.name: Anchor
entries: Shaped exactly like its seafaring counterpart, this anchor can be lowered down to land to allow a spelljammer to float without a Helmsman at the helm.

item.name: Arcane Cannon
entries: The arcane cannon is a unique spelljammer module, in that it must be installed in a medium or large hardpoint rather than using cargo space. In place of that weapon, this cannon allows a spellcaster to cast their spells and have them magnified to spelljammer scale as mega -spells.

To use an arcane cannon, a spellcaster must first be in the Gunner role. The spellcaster uses their action to charge the cannon for one round. On the following round, the spellcaster expends a spell slot to cast a spell through it. If the spellcaster doesn't cast a spell through it on the following round, the charge in the arcane cannon disperses harmlessly.

If you use your action to cast an evocation spell into the charged arcane cannon, you can choose a spelljammer instead of just a creature. The spell must have a duration of Instantaneous and a range of at least 5 feet. The DM can decide if a spell is inappropriate for use.

The arcane cannon transforms the spell into a mega-spell, scaling it up into spelljammer scale. Its range and the dimensions of its spell effects are multiplied by 100, toa maximum range of 10,000 feet. Also, the spell deals mega damage instead of normal damage.

If a spell cast through the arcane cannon targeting a spelljammer calls for a saving throw, the Helmsman makes that saving throw on behalf of the spelljammer itself. Abilities like Evasion don't affect this type of saving throw.

item.name: Brig
entries: Captains who have to deal with the transportation of creatures might look to invest in a dedicated brig. This room allows for the containment of up to 5 medium creatures with reasonable assurance. The details of this room, and how secure it is, is decided at construction.

item.name: Fighter Bay
entries: This fighter bay can store one fighter class spelljammer for use by a Fighter Helmsman.

item.name: Lifeboats
entries: These hard-shelled vessels are designed to fall toward the largest nearby gravity field. This is intended to land occupants on nearby planets, but be wary of using lifeboats close to suns and gas giants. The lifeboats prevent most damage from.  outside sources, but they cannot handle the stress of a Spelljammer Helm or traveling at spelljamming speed. Once they land, lifeboats cease to be a reasonable way to travel.
Each lifeboat takes up 1 ton of cargo space and can carry 5 medium creatures to safety.

item.name: Passage Device (Small)
entries: This device was created by the Arcane to make it easier on spelljammers to pass in and out of crystal spheres. It functions the same as casting the Create Portal spell but does not require a spellcaster.

Passage Devices come in two sizes. The smaller one is enough for any class of spelljammer up to and including Frigates. Heavy frigates and ships of the line need to pay more due to the size of their spelljammers.

item.name: Passage Device (Large)
entries: This device was created by the Arcane to make it easier on spelljammers to pass in and out of crystal spheres. It functions the same as casting the Create Portal spell but does not require a spellcaster.

Passage Devices come in two sizes. The smaller one is enough for any class of spelljammer up to and including Frigates. Heavy frigates and ships of the line need to pay more due to the size of their spelljammers.

item.name: Planetary Locator
entries: Created and sold only by Arcane purchased spelljammers, the Planetary Locator tracks all but the smallest of celestial bodies in an illusory three-dimensional display that includes the location of the spelljammer.

item.name: Plane Shift Drive
entries: This large device is built to store up residual energy over time that can be used toPlane Shift the spelliammer and every creature in the air envelope. Any creature at the edge of the air envelope can choose whether it plane shifts as well. This device can store up to two charges and charges are restored after a month. Only one charge can be recharged at a time.

item.name: Portal Locator
entries: This device was created by the Arcane to make it easier on spelljammers to locate portals to get in and out of crystal spheres. It functions the same as casting the Locate Portal spell but does not require a spellcaster.

item.name: Sickbay
entries: Illness and injury are bound to happen when traveling the stars, and without a dedicated healer onboard, a sickbay is a critical facility. The system has a pool of 6 medical dice, which are 1d8s. Each of these dice recharge in 24 hours after being used You can spend 1 minute in a sickbay and expend one or more of these dice to cause you or another creature in the sickbay to regain hit points equal to the value rolled.
Alternatively, you can expend 3 medical dice to cure yourself of any disease or poison afflicting you or another creature in the sickbay.

item.name: Workshop
entries: Whether the workshop is a fully functioning forge, a room full of tools and lumber for a carpenter, or bolts of cloth and threads for a tailor, this room provides anything an artisan would need Someone with an artisan tool proficiency can make use of this workshop to work on projects during travel.  Each workshop is built to fit a single tool proficiency.

item.name: Arcane Weaponry
entries: One spelljammer mounted weapon installed on your spelljammer gains a +1 bonus to attack rolls and has its range increased by 500 feet. You can choose this upgrade more than once, applying it to a different weapon each time.  This upgrade can be enhanced to +2 or +3, but such magic is rare and not readily available in the market.

item.name: Assault Port
entries: A Fighter Helmsman can deploy from Fighter Bays as a bonus action instead of as an action.
Your spelljammer must be of Frigate size or larger to accept this upgrade.

item.name: Gliding Sails
entries: Your spelljammer movement speed increases by 500 feet if the Helmsman moves in a straight line.

item.name: Gunpowder Station
entries: One of your spelljammer's hardpoints has a gunpowder station built for it. Cannons mounted on this hardpoint can ignore the Loading type. You can choose this upgrade more than once, applying it to a different weapon each time.

item.name: Helm Link
entries: Your spelljammer is able to link itself to another willing spelljammer. When you accelerate to spelljamming speed, the linked spelljammer is carried along at your speed.
Your spelljammer must be able to have a Helm to accept this upgrade.

item.name: Internal Reinforcements
entries: You have improved the integrity of your fighter craft by filling every hollow space with lightweight reinforcements. Your schooner class or smaller spelljammer's hull points increase by 10.

item.name: Reinforced Bulwark
entries: With the help of your spelljammer's Boatswain, you find ways to make your spelljammer easier to repair on the fly, increasing its bulwark points by 6.

item.name: Reinforced Hardpoint
entries: One of your spelljammer's hardpoints is reinforced, helping whichever weapon is mounted on it shrug off attacks. Your spelljammer mounted weapon on this hardpoint has 20 hull points instead of 10. You can choose this upgrade more than once, applying it to a different hardpoint each time.

item.name: Reinforced Hull
entries: Your spelljammer's hull is reinforced with a tougher material of your choice, increasing your spelljammer's AC by 1.

item.name: Stripped Hull
entries: You strip your hull of as much excess material as possible.  Your spelljammer's maneuverability increases by 1 step, but its AC is reduced by 2.

item.name: Turreted Hardpoint
entries: One of your spelljammer's hardpoints has a turret platform added to it. When a Gunner uses a weapon mounted on this hardpoint, they can use a bonus action to turn the hardpoint to change the facing of the mounted weapon. You can choose this upgrade more than once, applying it to a different hardpoint each time.

item.name: Light Ballista
entries: These top loaded siege weapons look much like a large crossbow. Unlike some models of ballista which are anchored to the ground at two points, the spelljammer variants have a central reinforced beam on a pivot. The Heavy Ballista makes use of a two-point anchor, but it rests on manually rotating platform that supporting crew can turn to help aim.

item.name: Medium Ballista
entries: These top loaded siege weapons look much like a large crossbow. Unlike some models of ballista which are anchored to the ground at two points, the spelljammer variants have a central reinforced beam on a pivot. The Heavy Ballista makes use of a two-point anchor, but it rests on manually rotating platform that supporting crew can turn to help aim.

item.name: Heavy Ballista
entries: These top loaded siege weapons look much like a large crossbow. Unlike some models of ballista which are anchored to the ground at two points, the spelljammer variants have a central reinforced beam on a pivot. The Heavy Ballista makes use of a two-point anchor, but it rests on manually rotating platform that supporting crew can turn to help aim.

item.name: Light Catapult
entries: A classic siege weapon that uses stored up tension in a single limb to release some projectile at high speeds toward a target. Many traditional catapults have lockable wheels so they can be moved and fired, but the spelljammer variant is built into the hardpoint itself.

item.name: Medium Catapult
entries: A classic siege weapon that uses stored up tension in a single limb to release some projectile at high speeds toward a target. Many traditional catapults have lockable wheels so they can be moved and fired, but the spelljammer variant is built into the hardpoint itself.

item.name: Heavy Catapult
entries: A classic siege weapon that uses stored up tension in a single limb to release some projectile at high speeds toward a target. Many traditional catapults have lockable wheels so they can be moved and fired, but the spelljammer variant is built into the hardpoint itself.

item.name: Carronade
entries: These short barreled cannons were among the first gunpowder based cannons to be built for spelljammer use. The interior of the gun barrel is smooth rather than rifled, resulting in shorter range than other comparable weapons. Nevertheless, it remains a popular choice for how efficient it is at short ranges.

item.name: 12-Pounder Long Gun
entries: These cannons are the most common type found in space. With long barrels with rifling, their range and power is a force to be reckoned with.  Nevertheless, gunpowder carries danger to those sailing in the Phlogiston and always has a chance to backfire.

item.name: 24-Pounder Long Gun
entries: These cannons are the most common type found in space. With long barrels with rifling, their range and power is a force to be reckoned with.  Nevertheless, gunpowder carries danger to those sailing in the Phlogiston and always has a chance to backfire.

item.name: 36-Pounder Long Gun
entries: This ridiculously oversized cannon is a favorite of the gunpowder obsessed Giff. The large amount of gunpowder used per shot results in the weapon overheating each time it is fired.

item.name: Fire Projector
entries: This small cannon consists of a series of tubes that pump a special chemical compound that ignites into flame when it touches air.

item.name: Artifurnace
entries: This Helm is a modernized version of the Furnace Helm. Like the Furnace Helm, the Artifurnace is designed to burn magical items to draw their magic into the Helm and create propulsion. However, the Artifurnace is designed specifically to draw power off of an Artifact magic item which is indestructible. This makes the Artifurnace an endless source of propuslion.
This Helm counts as an 11th level spellcaster for Spell Surge and hover sailing, though a Helmsman is still needed

item.name: Crown of Stars
item.reqAttune: by a creature with spellcasting or pact magic
entries: This Helm functions identically to a Spelljammer Helm (Minor), except that it takes the form of a piece of equipment (such as a crown). While using this Helm, a Helmsman can act both in spelljammer combat as a Helmsman and in regular combat against boarding parties. If the Helmsman leaves the spelljammer's air envelope, attunement to this Helm immediately ends.

item.name: Death Helm
item.reqAttune: by a creature with spellcasting or pact magic
entries: This Helm functions and appears identical to a Spelljammer Helm (Major).

entries.name: Cursed Item
entries: Whenever attuned to by a spellcaster, the spellcaster must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the Helm. While {@condition charmed} this way, the attuned spellcaster finds themselves intensely enjoying the feeling of using the Helm, even as it drains their life away. The attuned spellcaster resists all attemts to remove them from the Helm.  Each day of use, the attuned spellcaster gains one point of {@condition exhaustion} and must start making a special series of death saving throws. These saving throws don't reset on a long rest and they are not cleared when they reach 3 successes. These death saving throws are made until attunement is broken or the attuned spellcaster has 3 failures and dies.
An attuned spellcaster that succeeds on their save immediately realizes that something is wrong with the Helm and can choose to break attunement before it settles in.

entries.name: Unattunement Backlash
entries: When a Helmsman unattunes from this Helm, the Helmsman suffers a point of {@condition exhaustion} and must make a special death saving throw that accumulates with the cursed item effect.

item.name: Furnace Helm (Minor)
entries: This Helm takes the form of a furnace that is situated at the center of a ship. Magic items can be burned in the furnace to create propulsion. For every 1,000gp of value burned this way, the furnace generates one week's worth of propulsion.  Since the Furnace Helm depend upon fire, they are never used in the phlogiston.
The Minor variant of this Helm can only be used on Cutters (Mega-Tiny) or Schooner (Mega-Small) size ships.

item.name: Furnace Helm (Major)
entries: This Helm takes the form of a furnace that is situated at the center of a ship. Magic items can be burned in the furnace to create propulsion. For every 1,000gp of value burned this way, the furnace generates one week's worth of propulsion.  Since the Furnace Helm depend upon fire, they are never used in the phlogiston.

The Major variant of this Helm can be situated on a ship from Cutter (Mega-Tiny) to Frigate (Mega-Large) size. When hover sailing, every 1,000gp burned corresponds to one spell slot level (maximum of 5) To use Spell Surge, you burn additional items. Every 1,000gp corresponds to one spell slot level (maximum of 5), though each of these items have a 25% chance of causing an explosion that deals {@dice 10d10} mega fire damage to your spelljammer.

item.name: Series Helm
item.reqAttune: by a creature with spellcasting or pact magic
entries: This rare Helm is a series of specialized Spelljammer Helms.  Each link can be attuned to by a different creature, but only one attuned creature can be the Helmsman at a time. They can transfer the role as an action.
When the Helmsman uses Spell Surge or is hover sailing, each creature can add up to 3 spell slots worth of levels to amplify the power of the Helm, up to a maximum of 9 levels.

entries.name: Quick Attunement
entries: Functions identically to a minor Spelljammer Helm.

entries.name: Unattunement Backlash
entries: Functions identically to a minor Spelljammer Helm.

item.name: Spelljammer Helm (Minor)
item.reqAttune: by a creature with spellcasting or pact magic
entries: This ornamental throne covered in Arcane runes comes in two varieties: Minor and Major. The minor variant can be installed into any Schooner (Mega-Small) through Frigate (Mega-Large) sized spelljammers.

entries.name: Quick Attunement
entries: A spellcaster can immediately attune to this Helm instead of taking an hour by expending a 2nd- level spell slot.

entries.name: Unattunement Backlash
entries: When a Helmsman unattunes from this Helm, the Helmsman is unable to cast spells for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

item.name: Spelljammer Helm (Major)
item.reqAttune: by a creature with spellcasting or pact magic
entries: This ornamental throne covered in Arcane runes comes in two varieties: Minor and Major. The major variant is required for Heavy Frigates (Mega-Huge) or Ships of the Line (Mega-Gargantuan).

entries.name: Quick Attunement
entries: A spellcaster can immediately attune to this Helm instead of taking an hour by expending a 5th-level spell slot.

entries.name: Unattunement Backlash
entries: When a Helmsman unattunes from this Helm, the Helmsman is unable to cast spells for {@dice 2d4} rounds.

item.name: Giff Gunpowder Grenade
entries: An improvised weapon of the Giff. The DC for saving throws against these grenades is based on the fabricating Giff's abilities and is equal to 8 + their Constitution modifier + their proficiency bonus.

As an action, you can throw a Giff Gunpowder Grenade up to 60 feet. Each creature in a 15-foot cube must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Based on the level of Giff fabricating the grenade, the damage increases to {@damage 3d6} at 6th level, {@damage 4d6} at 11th level and {@damage 5d6} at 16th level. This explosion damages the area, causing it to become difficult terrain.

trait.name: Mega Creature
entries: This creature is far larger than Gargantuan size. It occupies an area 1,000 feet long by 1,000 feet wide.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the Astereater can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the astereater remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate asteroid.

trait.name: Strong Bite
entries: The astereater has advantage on attack rolls against {@condition grappled} spelljammers and mega-creatures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The astereater makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5OOft., one target. Hit 14 ({@dice 2d10 + 5}) mega piercing damage. A spelljammer or mega-creature of sloop (mega-medium) size or smaller is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and is {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends.

optionalfeature.name: Boatswain
entries: While in the Boatswain role, at the start of your turn, your spelljammer heals a number of bulwark points equal to half its maximum, rounded up.

optionalfeature.name: Brace for Impact
entries: As an action, you ready the crew for an attack. Choose one 90? side of your spelljammer. Until the start of your next turn, the first attack that hits that side of your spelljammer each turn has its mega-damage reduced by your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Fix It Up
entries: As an action, you can repair a spelljammer mounted weapon, module, or sail that has been disabled. When you do, make a DC 15 Intelligence (Carpenter's Tools) check. On a success, that spelljammer mounted weapon, module, or sail is repaired up to 1 hull point and becomes functional again.

optionalfeature.name: Work The Sails
entries: As an action, you push the crew to work the sails and increased the spelljammer's maneuverability. The first time your spelljammer moves before the start of your next turn, its maneuverability is increased by 45°, up to 135°.

optionalfeature.name: Hurry Up
entries: As an action, you push the crew to work as hard as they can on weapons and repairs. Your spelljammer's bulwark points are immediately restored to full and any Gunner that takes the Open Fire action before the start of your next turn can make one additional weapon attack. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Expert Boatswain
entries: When you take the Brace for Impact action, you instead choose a 180° side of your spelljammer.

optionalfeature.name: Hard Turn
entries: As an action, you lead the crew in managing the sails. The first time your spelljammer moves before the start of your next turn, its maneuverability is increased by 90° up to 180°.  Once you use this feature, you can't use it until you (and the crew) complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Master Boatswain
entries: While in the Boatswain role, your spelljammer has a number of extra bulwark points equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Captain
entries: While in the Captain role, you can have all bridge crew aboard the spelljammer take their turn at your initiative and you choose who goes in which order. When you do so, any effects that occur at the start or end of turn for all bridge crew occur at the start and end of your turn. If you leave this role, everyone resumes acting on their own initiative starting at the beginning of next round.

optionalfeature.name: Fire At Will
entries: As an action, you can call out an order to fire, allowing one Gunner of your choosing to use their reaction and make one weapon attack against a target in range.

optionalfeature.name: Boarding Party
entries: When your spelljammer is in the same space as another spelljammer of sloop size or larger, you can call for a boarding party. Choose any number of player characters and/or mercenaries (yourself included) who have not yet used their action to join the boarding party. Each of those creatures that chooses to join uses their action at the same time to board the other spelljammer. Creatures in the boarding party no longer occupy a ship combat role and may fight by normal combat rules against creatures aboard the other spelljammer on their turn in the initiative order.

optionalfeature.name: Spyglass
entries: As an action, you can take out your spyglass and roll an Intelligence (Investigation) check to get information about another spelljammer, mega-creature, or object found in space. This information can include anything that can be reasonably assessed from the spyglass, such as the condition of the weapons, sails, hull, how many creatures are visible, and so on.

optionalfeature.name: Full Speed Ahead
entries: As an action, you call out an order to the Helmsman. They can use their reaction to immediately move the spelljammer up to half its movement speed (rounded down) within its cone of movement. It can't turn after this movement.

optionalfeature.name: Expert Captain
entries: When you take the Boarding Party action, other members of your boarding party only expend a bonus action to board the other spelljammer, allowing them to use their action to attack as soon as they board.

optionalfeature.name: Barrage
entries: When you use your Fire at Will feature, you may choose to allow two Gunners to make reaction attacks. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Master Captain
entries: While in the Captain role, you have advantage on Initiative rolls when entering combat.

optionalfeature.name: Fighter Helmsman
entries: While in the Fighter Helmsman role, you can use your action to deploy a schooner-sized fighter craft from your spelljammer. When you do, your token is placed within 500 feet of your spelljammer.  You can only switch to a different role if your fighter is in the same space as a friendly spelljammer that has an empty Fighter Bay module.
Movement functions the same as the Helmsman's Move action except you don't expend an action to do it. You can only move once per turn.
The crew requirement of spelljammer mounted weapons you use while in a fighter is reduced by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Eject
entries: In reaction to your fighter being destroyed, you can eject yourself from your fighter. You remain lingering in space until you either run out of air, or a spelljammer or mega-creature picks you up.

optionalfeature.name: Attack
entries: As an action, you can attack with your spelljammer mounted weapon as if you were wielding it. You add your proficiency bonus and Dexterity or Strength (based on the weapon) modifier to attack and damage rolls. If you have a class feature that allows you to make multiple attacks each turn (such as Extra Attack), you can make additional attacks with your spelljammer mounted weapon. In addition, other class features which apply to weapon attacks can be used with your spelljammer mounted weapon.
Attacks made with spelljammer mounted weapons can only target ships and mega-creatures at spelljammer scale.

optionalfeature.name: Targeted Attack
entries: While you are within 1,000 feet of a spelljammer, you can attempt to disable one of its modules, weapons, or sails.  Make an attack against the spelljammer with disadvantage.  On a hit, you deal damage first to the spelljammer's bulwark points (if any), and then to the module, weapon, or sail of choice. All damage dealt to these targets is also applied to the hull Ifa module, weapon, or sail is reduced to 0 hull points, it becomes disabled.

If you use this feature to attack a mega-creature, you can target one of its natural weapons. On hit, the mega-creature has disadvantage on attacks with that natural weapon until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Emergency Repair
entries: As a bonus action, you quickly turn your attention to patching up damage on your fighter. Your fighter regains twice your class level in hull points, and then also gains that many temporary hull points. Once you've used this ability, you cannot do so again for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Expert Fighter Helmsman
entries: When you use your reaction to Eject, your fighter counts as if it had the Quick Eject feature. If your fighter already has the Quick Eject feature, you move at double speed.
In addition, your fighter has 8 bulwark points while you are piloting it. These bulwark points only replenish when docked aboard a friendly spelljammer.

optionalfeature.name: Dodge & Strike
entries: When you use your reaction to Eject, your fighter counts as if it had the Quick Eject feature. If your fighter already has the Quick Eject feature, you move at double speed.
In addition, your fighter has 8 bulwark points while you are piloting it. These bulwark points only replenish when docked aboard a friendly spelljammer.

optionalfeature.name: Master Fighter Helmsman
entries: When you take the Targeted Attack action, you don't make the attack at disadvantage.
Additionally, your fighter's bulwark points increase to 16.

optionalfeature.name: Gunner
entries: While in the Gunner role, you command the crew of a single spelljammer mounted weapon on your spelljammer. You can use a bonus action to switch to another weapon if available.

optionalfeature.name: Open Fire
entries: As an action, you can attack with your spelljammer mounted weapon as if you were wielding it. You add your proficiency bonus and either Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice) to ranged attacks roll, but you don't add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage roll. Attacks made with spelljammer mounted weapons can only target ships and mega-creatures at spelljammer scale.
Special Note: You don't have disadvantage on this attack roll if another spelljammer or mega-creature is nearby, only if you are boarded and being attacked.

optionalfeature.name: Trained Gunner
entries: When you take the Open Fire! action, you can make multiple attacks with the spelljammer mounted weapon if you have a class feature (such as Extra Attack) that allows you to make multiple attacks each turn. In addition, other class features which apply to ranged attack rolls now apply to your attacks with spelljammer mounted weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Readied Attack
entries: As an action, you ready yourself to use the Open Fire action when a specified event occurs. When you take this action, name a moment you're waiting for. Until the start of your next turn, if that event occurs, you can use your reaction to take the Open Fire action at that time. Often this can be used to attack spelljammers that are approaching with hostile intent all at once.

optionalfeature.name: Precise Shot
entries: Once per turn when you hit a spelljammer or mega-creature with a weapon attack using a spelljammer mounted weapon, you deal extra mega-damage equal to your Strength or Dexterity modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Expert Gunner
entries: While in the Gunner role, the crew requirement of spelljammer mounted weapons you use is reduced by 1.

optionalfeature.name: Distracting Shot
entries: When you hit a spelljammer or mega-creature with a weapon attack using a spelljammer mounted weapon, you can target a vulnerable point to cause them to lower their guard. When you do, roll {@dice 1d6} and add it to the mega-damage of the attack.  The next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than you has advantage if the attack is made before the start of your next turn. Once you use this feature you can't use it until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Master Gunner
entries: Your Precise Shot feature now applies to every attack you make in a round.

optionalfeature.name: Helmsman
entries: To occupy the role of Helmsman, you must meet all requirements to attune to the Helm currently installed on your spelljammer and be attuned to it. To switch out of this role, you must break attunement. There may be an Unattunement Backlash effect if you don't take your time to do so, as listed in the Helm's description.
While you are in the Helmsman role, you gain control over the spelljammer like it is an extension of your body and can extend your senses to any spot aboard the spelljammer (no action required).

Each spelljammer and mega-creature faces a particular direction in 45-degree intervals which can be represented by the eight cardinal and intercardinal directions. To give the feeling of momentum to spelljammers, each spelljammer has a maneuverability score that limits them to a cone of movement. This cone extends forward and is as wide as the maneuverability score of the spelljammer.

optionalfeature.name: Move
entries: As an action, you move the spelljammer up to its speed within the spelljammer's cone of movement. Once you have finished moving, you can rotate your spelljammer up to its maneuverability score.

optionalfeature.name: Match Speed
entries: As an action, you can attempt to match speed with another spelljammer. You choose a spelljammer that you can see, and until the beginning of your next turn, your spelljammer mimics their movements and attempts to maintain the same distance as when you used this action. If the other spelljammers performs a movement you're unable to mimic with your spelljammer's statistics, this effect ends.

optionalfeature.name: Spelljamming
entries: As an action, you can start charging the spelljammer to accelerate to spelljamming speed. After 1 minute, the spelljammer accelerates to spelljamming speed.

optionalfeature.name: Evasive Maneuvers
entries: If your spelljammer is Frigate sized or smaller, you can use your action to perform evasive maneuvers instead of moving normally. When you do so, until the beginning of your next turn, you add your Dexterity modifier to the spelljammer's AC and have advantage on Dexterity saving throws you make on behalf of the spelljammer.

optionalfeature.name: Ram
entries: If your spelljammer is of Heavy Frigate size or smaller (and you feel particularly foolhardy), you can ram your spelljammer directly into a target by moving up to your speed within your come of movement and entering a spelljammer or mega-creature's space. Your spelljammer and target each take {@damage 2d10} mega bludgeoning damage. Larger spelljammers deal and take more damage in a ram: Sloops deal {@damage 3d10}, and Frigates and Heavy Frigates deal {@damage 4d10}.

optionalfeature.name: Dogfighting
entries: If your spelljammer is a Frigate or smaller, and a spelljammer of the same size or smaller is behind you within 1,000ft, you can use your action to perform a complex maneuver. Make a Dexterity (Water Vehicles) check, contested by the other spelljammer. On a success, following several tight turns, you switch places with that ship. The direction both spelljammer's are facing remain the same.

optionalfeature.name: Expert Helmsman
entries: You can use the Evasive Maneuvers and Dogfighting actions with Heavy Frigate size spelljammers.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Surge
entries: As an action, you may expend a spell slot of any level less than or equal to your proficiency bonus. You take the Move action but with an extra 500ft. movement per level of the expended spell slot, but only in a straight line. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Master Helmsman
entries: While you are in the Helmsman role, your spelljammer has 500ft. of additional movement speed.

race.name: Dohwar
entries: As a Dohwar, you have the following characteristics.

entries.name: Age
entries: Dohwar have lifespans similar to humans.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Dohwar are generally indifferent to moral circumstance and lean toward chaotic.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dohwar are short and stocky, reaching an average height of 4ft. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dohwar.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

entries.name: Cold Adaptation
entries: You are naturally adapted to cold climates, as {@book as described in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide|dmg|5|extreme cold}. You also have resistance to cold damage.

entries.name: Merchant's Senses
entries: Whenever you perform an Intelligence (History) check, or tools to determine the origin and value of an object, you are considered proficient in the check and can add double your proficiency bonus.
When you reach 3rd level, you learn to cast {@spell Detect Magic} and {@spell Identify} as a ritual, though you still require material components to do so.

entries.name: Silent Speech
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature within 30 feet of you. The creature understands you only if the two of you share a language. You can speak telepathically in this way to one creature at a time.

entries.name: Mind Reading
entries: You can cast the {@spell Detect Thoughts} spell a number of times per day equal to your proficiency modifier, but you can only pick up surface thoughts. If a creature is aware of the dohwar's ability to do this, they can make an Intelligence saving throw to resist the effect. While reading a creature's surface thoughts, you have advantage on all Wisdom (Insight), Charisma (Persuasion), and Charisma (Deception) checks against the target.

Skillful, adventurous, and graceful. These are words no one would ever use to describe the dohwar. Heavily feathered but flightless birds, the dohwar appear to resemble penguins.  They are a species of highly mercantilistic people who travel around the many spheres in their ongoing trade war with the Great Rival: the Arcane. To date, the Arcane is barely aware of their existence.

At first glance, many might think a dohwar would be dextrous like other avian creatures. This is anything but the truth. The Dohwar tend to be incredibly clumsy and sluggish in their movement. They have small bodies that work against the few of them that seek a life of martial combat, though that hasn't stopped a few from becoming one of the 'legendary' Dohwar Deathsquealers.

One might then think that being a mercantilistic race, the dohwar must be a persuasive race, able to talk people into deals. That's also not the case. The dohwar have foregone any social grace in favor of a highly aggressive personality that is often offputting. When the dohwar want to make a deal with someone, multiple dohwar usually show up and each of them starts recounting their list of items for sale and prices, as well as what they will offer to pay for the items the person has. They don't haggle so much as keep screaming prices at you until a deal is struck. Oddly enough though, this seems to work for them.

The dohwar are a telepathic species, able to quickly and efficiently communicate with one another while they are working on trade deals. They can also turn this telepathy outwards to detect the thoughts of would-be customers to play that to their advantage in dealings.

They are a highly ragged looking species, rarely dressed in fine clothing in favor of whatever works for them. They seem to be a mess, but in reality this is all a show. The dohwar are a highly developed and organized trade machine that thoroughly believe the entire universe is out to get them.

race.name: Dracon
entries: As a dracon, you have the following traits:

entries.name: Age
entries: Dracons have lifespans similar to humans.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Dracons are generally seen as neutral, though they favor good acts and an orderly life.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dracons are more long than tall. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

entries.name: Charge
entries: If you move at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, as a bonus action you can make one attack against the target using your hooves.

entries.name: Diplomatic
entries: You gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill.

entries.name: Equine Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag.

In addition, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your equine legs. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot.

entries.name: Herd Mentality
entries: During a long rest, you visit each of your companions to build comradery. Choose up to 6 friendly creatures you are spending the rest with within 30 feet or the same inn, campsite, etc. Each of these creatures gains temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier for the following day.

entries.name: Hooves
entries: Your hooves count as natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you cause bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier instead of the normal damage for an unarmed strike.
The Dracon are a new species to the spheres. They look like a mixture of a centaur and a brontosaur, with the torso and arms of a human and the head of a dragon. They have flat feet and a long tail.

Dracons tend to be vegetarians with a strong herd mentality toward their own kind You'll rarely see a dracon alone, as they prefer to travel in family units where the elder is the leader. This bond is so strong that dracons left isolated from their families become sick until they manage to find a new familial unit to be a part of.

Dracon tend to have a strong orderly way about them. They organize themselves in hierarchies where those who take up positions of leadership do so out of duty rather than ambition.  They don't even have clashes over interaction between.  various hierarchies. If one family comes into contact with another family, they immediately work out which one becomes the leader between them. There is no bad blood or shame for letting the other family lead.

race.name: Giff
entries: As a giff, you have the following traits:

entries.name: Age
entries: Giff have lifespans similar to humans.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Giff are almost always lawful

entries.name: Size
entries: Giff stand between 8 and 9 feet tall and generally weigh 300 pounds or more. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Giff, and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Headfirst Charge
entries: If you move at least 20 feet in a straight line that ends within 5 feet of a large or smaller creature, as an action you can have that creature make a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + proficiency bonus + Strength modifier) or take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

entries.name: Giff Gunpowder Training
entries: You are proficient with gunpowder firearms and the backfire score of any spelljammer mounted weapon you use is reduced by 1.

In addition, whenever you take a long rest, you can spend an hour of time mixing saltpeter, sulfur, and charcoal to make Giff Gunpowder Grenades. You can carry a number of grenades equal to your proficiency bonus. The DC for saving throws against these grenades is equal to 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus.

As an action, you can throw a {@item Giff Gunpowder Grenade|sjmais} up to 60 feet. Each creature in a 15-foot cube must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to {@damage 3d6} at 6th level, {@damage 4d6} at 11th level and {@damage 5d6} at 16th level This explosion damages the area, causing it to become difficult terrain.

entries.name: Magic Resistance
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

It's hard to miss a giff. Standing upwards of 8 to 9 feet tall, the giff are a large, muscular race of well dressed and posh humanoid hippopotami. They have a well deserved reputation for being brave mercenaries, so long as it pays well and in their preferred method: gunpowder.

While the giff are hulking masses of muscle, their speed and grace often catch others by surprise. When working with other giff in a fight, they work with such elegance and poise that many could compare their motion to that of the elves.  Although they have the reputation for physical strength and grace, they have never been considered among the wisest or smartest of species to travel the spheres.

Few things excite a giff like gunpowder. The bigger the explosion, the stronger the burst of fire, the brighter the flash of the detonating of grenades, all of these are things the giff seek. Due to this fascination, the giff are among the best species for handling gunpowder. Their talent for gunpowder weaponry makes them among the best for handling spelljammer cannons.

In the past, giff weren't able to use magic of any kind. This relegated the giff into working as mercenaries or with mercenaries since they couldn't use a Spelljammer Helm. As of recent years however, spellcasting giff have started to show up around the spheres.

race.name: Hadozee
entries: As a hadozee, you have the following traits:

entries.name: Age
entries: Hadozee reach maturity around the age of 20 and live to be upwards of 200 years old.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Hadozee tend toward neutrality. There's not much they won't do for the right captain and coin.

entries.name: Size
entries: Hadozee are taller than humans on average, but because they regularly slouch, they appear to be about a foot shorter. Young hadozee tend to be slender and they pick up weight and bulk the older they get. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Hadozee. Hadozee is almost identical to Elven, except that it includes many insults and curses from other languages.

entries.name: Prehensile Feet
entries: You have prehensile feet capable of working as either feet or hands. On any turn, you can sacrifice half of your movement speed to gain either an additional object interaction or wield a weapon with the light property. This additional weapon doesn't grant an extra attack, but it does mean you can dual wield while climbing on ropes, trees, or similar.

entries.name: Monkey Fighting
entries: While climbing, when you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can increase the reach of a single attack by 5 feet. Additionally, when climbing you can take the disengage action as a bonus action.

entries.name: Gliding Leap
entries: You can use your membranes betwene your limbs as wings to slow your fall or allow you to glide. While you fall and aren't incapacitated or wearing heavy armor, you are considered under the effects of Slow Fall, and for every 5 feet you descend, you can move 10 feet horizontally.

Hadozee, often referred to as "deck apes", are a species of tall and slender ape-ike creatures covered in shaggy hair with a thick mane, a protuding snout, and a membrane between their arms and their body. They are a nimble species used to climbing trees, jumping between branches, and extending out their arms to glide over long distances like a flying squirrel.

The hadozee tend to come from jungle worlds. They depart from those worlds in their youth and make their way around space working as deckhands on spelljammers. Hadozee love to work aboard spelljammers, finding the tall masts similar to the tree tops that they once climbed. Their gliding ability comes in handy quite often as they can quickly descend from a high mast down to a deck in a moment's notice. Their ability to use their feet like hands makes them among the most agile and capable deckhands around.

Hadozee also make for effective boarding party troops. Due to their ability to glide, when they leap to another spelljammer, they can land on any deck with ease, giving them a unique tactical advantage.

The other unique feature of the hadozee is their language.  It is often joked that hadozee are so vulgar, they could make a sailor blush. It is a common event to hear a hadozee stringing along curses and insults at the most minor offense.

After their service to the Elven Imperial Navy during the Unhuman Wars, the elves have begun to accept Hadozee into the Elven Imperial Navy on an informal basis, While the elves still have their sense of superiority, the Hadozee are some of the only species the elves regularly work with.

Hadozee tend to travel throughout their youth before they settle down on a jungle world with other hadozee. They raise their kids on the trees of that world to get them ready for the masts of a spelljammer.

race.name: Mind Flayer
entries: As a mind flayer, you have the following traits:

entries.name: Age
entries: Mind flayers are created through ceremorphosis fully matured. They live an average of 125 years, at which point their brain is reintegrated back in with its elder brain.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Mind flayers lean toward lawful evil.

entries.name: Size
entries: Mind flayers tend to be thin and as tall as their host.  Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Undercommon, & Deep Speech.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Telepathy
entries: You can speak telepathically to any creature within 30 feet of you. The creature understands you only if the two of you share a language. You can speak telepathically in this way to one creature at a time.

entries.name: Mind Blast
entries: As an action, you can release a blast of psionic energy in a 15-foot cone. All creatures in that cone must make an Intelligence saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your intelligence modifier. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} psychic damage. At 6th level, this damage increases to {@damage 3d8}, and at 11th level, the creature is stunned until the end of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Devour Brain
entries: When you devour the brain of a humanoid creature, you can acquire the memories that creature had in life. If you do, you gain proficiency in a skill or tool that the creature had when they were alive. You lose this proficiency the next time you use this ability.
In addition, you can also gather information from the creature's memory, subject to the DM's approval.

Among the oldest and most evil creatures in the universe, the mind flayer is a creature worthy of the fearful reputation it has earned. It is said they are a species from the far future, one that managed to conquer the spheres and devour all other lifeforms. With each dead species, so too did the gods die, and the stars slowly began to fade.

Not content to go quietly into the void, the mind flayers found a way to send their spelljammer fleets back in time to the beginning of the universe. This time, they would rule the spheres from the start of the universe, not the end of it.

However, this time their dominion was brought to an end.  The gith managed to bring down the mind flayer empire in a day. Countless elder brains were destroyed, resulting in the loss of a great deal of knowledge, including how to make their Nautiloid spelljammers.

The mind flayers now live in a precarious position. The more they grow, the more risk they run of the Gith showing up, but grow they must. This has lead to the mind flayers in space having a more cosmopolitan nature than those in the underdark of many worlds. While the mind flayers retain their malicious intent, they deal with other species as a way of acquiring more cattle and relics of the past that can help them rebuild their once great fleet.

race.name: Scro
entries: As a scro, you have the following traits:

entries.name: Age
entries: Scro reach adulthood at age 12 and live to about 40.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Scro appear as evil to those outside of Scro society and are lawful to the hierarchy's demands.

entries.name: Size
entries: Scro are taller than most orcs and stand upright.  Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common, Orcish, and Elvish.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Pack Tactics
entries: You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Glory Kill
entries: Scro take pride in ripping their enemies' throat out with their teeth. As a bonus action, you can use your powerful jaws to bite an enemy. Make an unarmed attack against an enemy with your teeth as a natural weapon. On a hit, this attack does {@damage 1d6} + Strength modifier in piercing damage. If this attack reduces the enemy to 0, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level.

Long ago a group of orcish tribes were banished from the known spheres by the Elven Imperial Navy in an event known as the first Unhuman Wars. For centuries since, no one has seen or heard anything of them. People just assumed that they were gone for good. Those people were wrong

Far out beyond the known spheres, the remnants of these orcish tribes unified under an orcish visionary leader named.  Dukagsh. Dukagsh saw that the orcs had lost the first Unhuman War because they had been so simplistic in their strategy and tactics. Just being good at spilling blood wasn't sufficient to defeat their enemies.

Over the decades, Dukagsh trained his people to be stronger, faster, and most importantly: smarter. They learned to fight, to survive, they developed a culture beyond their savage origins. Dukagsh pushed his people to read and learn, develop the knowledge and tactical ability that would make them a force to be reckoned with.

When Dukagsh was dying, he declared that his people were no longer orcs. They have turned away from their old path and found one that will be more successful. The old ways were gone, and this was the start of a new species. He named his people the scro.
Now centuries after the first Unhuman War, the scro returned to the known spheres to wage war again. Although the Elven Imperial Navy won this second war, it was far costlier than the first.
The scro are now here to stay. The Elven Imperial Navy may have won, but they couldn't push them back. As a scro, you inherit the legacy of Dukagsh.

race.name: Xixchil
entries: As a Xixchil, you have the following traits:

entries.name: Age
entries: Xixchil rapidly reach maturity by the age of 1.  Through modifications, a Xixchil can potentially live forever.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Xixchil lean toward chaotic neutral They always do what is best for themselves.

entries.name: Size
entries: Xixchil are as tall as elves. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your AC is 12 + Dexterity modifier. You cannot wear armor and cannot benefit from wearing a shield.  You can spend time and money to have heavy metal affixed to your body. Each procedure takes 1 week to complete and you must complete each level in order.

entries.name: Natural Scythes
entries: Your forelimbs are natural, surgically-sharp blades. Your scythes count as melee weapons with which you are proficient in. When you hit, the target takes {@damage 2d4} plus your Dexterity modifier in slashing damage. You cannot wield weapons or a shield.

entries.name: Extra Limbs
entries: You may surgically add two light melee weapons on extra limbs to your body. These limbs take one week and 10 times the weapon's cost to attach per limb.  When you take the attack action, you may make attack rolls with one or both additional limbs as a bonus action. These attacks are treated the same as making an offhand attack while two weapon fighting.

Xixchil are six-limbed praying mantis-like mantoids. They are known for their excellent crafting skill thanks to their scalpel- like claws at the end of their forelimbs. They blacksmith, tailor, leatherwork, tinker clockwork devices, and more.

Apart from their skill as crafters, the xixchil are also known for their main passion: surgery. Xixchil believe that the body is a house, and the only way to make it a home is to start developing it in a direct way. Xixchil actively seek out treasures of beauty to adorn their chitinous shells. So great is their love of this practice that most xixchil are referred to by their most prominent adornment. Even non-xixchil are welcomed to adorn themselves by paying a modest fee to a xixchil surgeon.
Xixchil have a survival of the fittest mentality. It is every individual xixchil's responsibility to improve themselves through study and modification.

spell.name: Aether Cloud
entries: You stir up the aether in a 1,000-foot radius sphere, causing it to become heavily obscured for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius of the cloud increases by 1,000 feet for each spell slot above 1st.

spell.name: Automatic Helm
entries: You touch a spelljammer Helm and grant it the limited ability to fly without a Helmsman. For the duration, the spelljammer flies in a straight line. If there are crew ready to work the sails, the spelljammer has 45° maneuverability. If it encounters obstacles, it will do its best to avoid the obstacle and then correct course. If the spelljammer has to make an ability check or saving throw, it makes these checks as if its ability scores were all 10 and it has no proficiency.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration increases to 8 hours.

spell.name: Create Air
entries: You create a single breath worth of clean air for your target.  If a creature is holding their breath, this allows them to reset their breath timer. If the creature is breathing lethal air, they don't gain the next point of {@condition exhaustion} as normal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature to receive this breath of air.

spell.name: Locate World
entries: This spell shows you the direction and distance to the nearest planet, planetoid, moon, or other celestial body in your current sphere. If you cast this spell while on a celestial body, it points at you and then ends.

spell.name: Turbulent Aether
entries: Choose a spelljammer you can see within range. The target spelljammer's Helmsman must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the spelljammer's speed is halved for the duration. The target spelljammer's Helmsman can repeat this save at the end of each of their turns, ending this effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature to receive this breath of air.

spell.name: Anchor Helm
entries: Choose a spelljammer you can see within range. The target's Helmsman must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target spelljammer can't accelerate to spelljamming speeds for the duration. If the spelljammer has already started charging to accelerate to spelljamming speeds, the jump can't commence until this spell has ended.  The target's Helmsman can attempt the saving throw again at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Blurry
entries: A spelljammer or mega-creature you touch becomes blurry, appearing as a shifting and ever moving object in space. For the duration, any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn't rely on sight, as with {@sense blindsight}, or can see through illusions, as with {@sense truesight}.

spell.name: Contact Home Power
entries: You blow a small horn and call to your deity. This establishes a tenuous link through the astral plane between you and your deity or their seat of power. For the duration of this spell, you can regain spell slots as you normally would When you complete this ritual, you regain all spell slots of 3rd level or higher that you didn't regain on your last long rest.  If your deity has abandoned a sphere, either through force or of their own choosing, this spell will fail. The caster will learn from the spell whether their god isn't willing to return to this sphere or if another god is blocking their return to this sphere. Repeated attempts may call unwanted attention upon the caster.

entries.name: Special
entries: This spell ends when you leave your current crystal sphere.

spell.name: Detect Powers

components.m: a fistful of sand cast at the sphere

entries: Casting this spell before entering a crystal sphere will allow you to determine if there are compatible powers (deities, ideals) that align with your faith and will allow you to regain spell slots naturally.
Additionally, you learn the alignment of the new deity if one exists. Accepting power from a god of opposing alignemnt might cause tension between you and your home deity.

spell.name: Jettison

components.m: a small chunk of an asteroid

entries: You conjure a wall of space debris up to 2,000 feet long, 1,000 feet wide, and 2,000 feet tall. Each spelljammer and mega-creature is slowed in this area; every foot of movement in that space costs one extra foot. Additionally, any mega- creature or spelljammer that moves into or through this space for the first time on its turn must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take {@dice 3d8} mega bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, they take half.
When attacks are made through this area, the target is treated as having half-cover.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot above 2nd.

spell.name: Locate Helm

components.m: a forked twig of the starfly plant

entries: You reach out and detect the presence of the nearest 5 Spelljammer Helms in the sphere. This spell doesn't tell you what kind of Helm, what kind of spelljammer it is attached to, whether the spelljammer is hostile or friendly, only that it exists and where it moves to over the duration.

spell.name: Locate Portal
entries: You focus your arcane abilities and attune them to a crystal sphere. You know instantly the nearest portal through the shell, either in or out of the Flow. You know the direction and distance of the portal If no active portals are available, you learn when and where it will open.

spell.name: Airsphere

components.m: a small crystal or glass sphere with air in it

entries: You create a mobile 20-foot radius sphere of fresh, breathable air identical to the air of your home world around you. For the duration, the air retains its spherical shape and pushes back any air or liquid. When this spell ends, the air continues to exist but it begins to follow natural laws again.  While concentrating on the sphere, the caster can move the sphere up to 90 feet as a bonus action. When you begin your turn with the sphere outside of the spell's range, concentration is broken and the air starts to obey natural laws again.

spell.name: Chill Fire

components.m: a sliver of glass or ice

entries: When cast while in the phlogiston, the flammable and explosive properties of the phlogiston are repressed in a 30-foot radius sphere from a point you can see. Fire and explosions do normal damage while in this place and do not backlash upon the spellcaster any more than it would in wildspace. If any fire extends beyond the range of this spell, it backlashes as normal.

spell.name: Hold Helm

components.m: a small, straight piece of thick wood

entries: Choose a spelljammer that you can see within range. The target spelljammer's Helmsman must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. At the end of each of each of their turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Melf's Meteors

components.m: niter, sulfur, and pine tar formed into a bead

entries: You hurl a cluster of meteors at a point you choose within range. Each mega-creature and Helmsman of a spelljammer within a 1,000-foot radius sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@dice 8d6} mega bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} mega bludgeoning points for each spell slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Stable Gravity
entries: You create a stable bubble of gravity around a spelljammer or mega-creature within range. For the duration, that spelljammer or mega-creature's gravity field isn't nullified by that of a larger source. This spell is commonly used to escape from the gravity of larger spelljammers or creatures.

spell.name: Enhance/Reduce Maneuverability

components.m: a piece of rope tied into a knot

entries: By manipulating the magic around the sails or body of a spelljammer or mega-creature within range, you enhance or reduce its maneuverability by 1 step. If a target is unwilling, they make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the spell takes hold.

spell.name: Softwood
entries: You touch a willing or {@condition unconscious} creature of Large size or smaller and enwrap it in a cocoon of soft, spongey wood.  This material is a magical plant that inhabits the target's entire air bubble and sustains its life at a lower-than-normal level The individual inside is placed in suspended animation and is rendered {@condition unconscious}. A creature at 0 hit points is stabilized by the spell, then regains consciousness and 1 hit point after {@dice 1d4} hours following the cocoon dissolving.

The softwood surrounding a creature is immune to extreme heat and cold environmental effects and is immune to all damage unless another creature takes the time to break off the softwood For example, someone cocooned in softwood could fall from wildspace through an atmosphere and crash land on a planet's surface without damaging the person within.
After being exposed to air for 30 minutes, the softwood will dissolve and the creature inside will awaken.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 6th level spell slot or higher, you can target an additional creature for every 2 slots above 4th.

spell.name: Create Portal
entries: You create a temporary portal on a crystal sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Until the end of this spell, that portal remains open and navigable by any spelljammers or mega-creatures. If this spell is ended early while a spelljammer or mega-creature is partially through the portal, that spelljammer or mega-creature must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the spelljammer or mega-creature takes {@dice 10d10} mega force damage. On a success, they take no damage. In either case, the spelljammer or mega-creature chooses which side of the sphere they end up on.

spell.name: Create Minor Helm

components.m: a stool, chair, or suitable seat

entries: You transform a normal chair or seat into a minor Spelljammer Helm suitable for use in powering a spelljammer through space. The spell must be cast again each day to stay active.

spell.name: Hold Mega-Creature

components.m: a small, straight piece of thick wood

entries: Choose a mega-creature that you can see within range. The mega-creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. At the end of each of each of their turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

spell.name: Collapse Portal

components.m: two smooth stones of any size, one diamond, and one obsidian

entries: A rare spell, but one that people love to tell stories about, Collapse Portal allows you to cause disruption in the magic of an active portal on a crystal sphere. When this spell is cast, make a DC 15 ability check using your spellcasting ability. On a success, the spell works and until the end of the spell's duration, you can use a reaction to close the portal around a spelljammer or mega-creature. Take note of of how much over the DC 15 check you were, if at all You can also choose to just close the portal on your turn.

A spelljammer or mega-creature caught in a collapsing portal must make a Dexterity saving throw. The DC is equal to 15 + the amount over the DC 15 spellcasting ability check you were when you cast the spell On a failure, the spelljammer or mega-creature takes {@dice 10d10} mega force damage. On a success, they take no damage. In either case, the spelljammer or mega-creature chooses which side of the sphere they end up on.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Chain
entries: Many scholars in wildspace have noted the tendency for either community-oriented or imperial civilizations to be the ones that make it out to the stars. In a place like Faerun, the various nations are often too busy fighting one another to ever focus on something as costly and risky as spelljammers.  Whether it be the colonies of illithids, herds of dracons, hives of thri-kreen, waddles of dohwar, armies of giff, or communities of elves, these species have a strong focus on unity and working together.

It is from these kinds of civilizations that arose the Circle of the Chain. These druids specialize in binding the life energy of a handful of creatures into a single collective called a chain. These druids cultivate the life of those in their chain both through their restorative magics and through draining the life of other creatures into the chain.

Although these practices originally arose among some communal species to help them move out into the stars, they have since caught on as a valuable skillset to adventuring groups and spelljammer crews.

entries.name: Circle Spells
entries: You gain access to some spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Circle of the Chain Spells table.

Once you gain access to one of these spells, you always have it prepared, and it doesn't count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. If you gain access to a spell that doesn't appear on the druid spell list, the spell is nonetheless a druid spell for you.

entries.name: Form Chain
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you learn how to bind the life energy of a group of creatures into a collective called a chain. As a bonus action, you can expend a use of your Wild Shape feature to link up to 6 willing creatures in a chain, rather than transforming into a beast.

Until the network ends, all creatures in the chain feel a sense of connection each other creature in the chain, as if they are all an extension of their own physical being. All creatures in the chain know the exact hit points and conditions afflicting any other creature in the chain at any time. The chain lasts for 10 minutes. It ends early if you dismiss it (no action required), are incapacitated, die, or use this feature again. The chain ends early on a creature if they are on a different plane of existence than you are.

entries.name: Always Near
entries: Whenever you expend a spell slot to cast a spell that restores hit points to a creature in your chain, you can ignore any range limitations of that spell.

entries.name: Recycle
entries: Whenever you expend a spell slot to cast a spell that deals necrotic damage to a creature not in your chain, you or another creature in your chain can regain hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your Wisdom modifier.

entries.caption: Circle of the Chain Spells
rows: {@spell mass cure wounds}, {@spell negative energy flood|xge}

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Chain
entries: Starting at 6th level, your ability to bind the life energy of a chain grows stronger. As an action, you can redistribute hit points between any creatures in your chain. The maximum number of hit points you can transfer is 5 times your Druid level. A creature cannot be reduced below 1 hit point. Once you have used this ability, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Recycling
entries: Starting at 10th level, your ability to recycle the life energy of other creatures into your chain is empowered. Whenever you use your Recycle feature, the {@dice 1d8} becomes a {@dice 2d8}.
In addition, whenever you cast a spell or use a feature that would restore hit points to a creature in your chain, you can instead distribute those hit points as you see fit to anyone in your chain.

subclassFeature.name: Unbroken Chain
entries: Starting at 14th level, your chain has become strong enough to even withstand a lethal attack. When a creature in your chain other than you is reduced to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to immediately redistribute hit points from your chain to that creature. You restore twice the number of hit points you remove from creatures in your chain, up to 50% of their maximum hit points.
Once you've used this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The First Helm
entries: It is said that when the spheres were young, two great creations were forged at the same time: The Spelljammer and The First Helm. While The Spelljammer is the first and oldest of all ships that sail the rainbow sea, the First Helm is the artifact from which all Spelljammer Helms are born.  Each Spelljammer Helm is connected to the First Helm, constantly sending information back to it from the mind of an attuned Helmsman. The stories say that the First Helm is gathering knowledge for some unspeakable horror to come.

Reasonable people recognize these stories as tall tales.  Reasonable people know that countless wizards have investigated that although they can't replicate Spelljammer Helms, there is no sign at all of information being extracted from a Helmsman. Reasonable people don't put much stock in silly, unsubstantiated rumors told by sailors with too much time on their hands.
{@i Reasonable people are wrong.}

You know that the First Helm is real You know that the First Helm has had its hand in the mind of every single person who has ever attuned to a Spelljammer Helm. You have glimpsed the depths of its accrued knowledge and recognize its power is greater than even that of the gods. The only reasonable thing to do is take its side.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The First Helm lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.name: Attuned Mind
entries: Starting at 1st level, the influence of the First Helm has granted you unique knowledge of spelljammers. You gain tool proficiency with water vehicles.

In addition, while attuned to a Spelljammer Helm, you can telepathically speak to any creature within your spelljammer's air envelope. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

subclassFeature.name: Mental Adaptability
entries: Starting at 6th level, you gain resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

In addition, as a bonus action on your turn, you can temporarily learn a spell from the Warlock spell list that you don't already know. For the next minute, you can cast this spell as if it was known. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Infinite Knowledge
entries: Starting at 10th level, as an action you can call upon the power of the First Helm to spontaneously cast a spell you don't know from the Wizard, Sorcerer, or Artificer spell list without expending a spell slot. This spell must have a casting time of 1 action and must be 5th-level or lower. You still need to provide costly components and perform verbal and/or somatic components when casting the spell. After you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
In addition, your Mystic Arcanum class features count as spell slots for Spell Surge and Hover Sailing.

subclassFeature.name: Perfectly Attuned
entries: Starting at 14th level, when you attune to a Spelljammer Helm, you are no longer rendered helpless. So long as you remain within the air envelope of your spelljammer, you can continue to control the spelljammer as if you were sitting on the Helm.
During combat, you can act both as a Helmsman in spelljammer combat and using your character abilities against boarding parties in ground combat.
In addition, you can Quick Attune to a Spelljammer Helm without expending a spell slot.
